required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Japanese Infants
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Open-Label Trial Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of a 13-valent Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Infants in Japan

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and immunogenicity of the 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) in infants of Japanese descent.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 μg/mL in the 13vPnC Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after 3-dose infant series (at 7 months of age)
primary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group Relative After the 3-Dose Infant Series
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one mone month after 3-dose infant series (at 7 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 μg/mL in the 13vPnC Group After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after the toddler dose (at 12 - 15 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group Relative After the Toddler Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after the toddler dose (at 12-15 months of age)
secondary_outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.

intervention.description: "First dose during 2 to 6 months of age Second dose at least 28 days after the first dose Third dose at least 28 days after the second dose Forth dose during 12 to 15 months of age"

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy 2 to 6 month-old infant
- Available for entire study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous vaccination with licensed or investigational pneumococcal vaccine.
- Previous anaphylactic reaction to any vaccine or vaccine-related component.
- Contraindication to vaccination with a pneumococcal conjugate vaccine.
- Bleeding diathesis or condition associated with prolonged bleeding time that would contraindicate any type of injection.
- Known or suspected immune deficiency or suppression.

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited in Japan from September 2007 to February 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were enrolled into the study according to inclusion/exclusion criteria without a screening period.

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 2, 4, 6 months (infant series) and 12-15 months of age (toddler dose).

group.title: 13vPnC
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 2, 4, 6 months (infant series) and 12-15 months of age (toddler dose).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 μg/mL in the 13vPnC Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
outcome.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: one month after 3-dose infant series (at 7 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population had valid and determinate assay results and had no other major protocol violations.

group.title: 13vPnC After Infant Series
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 2, 4, 6 months (infant series).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Antibody Level ≥ 0.35 μg/mL in the 13vPnC Group After the 3-Dose Infant Series
measure.description: Percentages of participants achieving World Health Organization (WHO) predefined antibody threshold ≥ 0.35 μg/mL along with the corresponding 95% CI for the 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
measure.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population had valid and determinate assay results and had no other major protocol violations.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
outcome.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 2 months of age (infant series Dose 1).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 4 months of age (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 6 months of age (infant series Dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Participants received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at 12-15 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Local Reactions
measure.description: Local reactions were collected using an electronic diary. Tenderness was scaled as Any (tenderness present); Significant (present and interfered with limb movement). Swelling and redness were scaled as Any (swelling or redness present); Mild (0.5 centimeters [cm] to 2.0 cm); Moderate (2.5 to 7.0 cm); Severe (>7.0 cm). Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: The safety population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
outcome.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication to treat symptoms, and use of medication to prevent symptoms) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
outcome.population: The safety population included all subjects who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 1
group.description: Subjects received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 2 months of age (infant series Dose 1).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 2
group.description: Subjects received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 4 months of age (infant series Dose 2).

group.title: 13vPnC Dose 3
group.description: Subjects received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at approximately 6 months of age (infant series Dose 3).

group.title: 13vPnC Toddler Dose
group.description: Subjects received one single 0.5mL dose of 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (13vPnC) at 12-15 months of age (toddler dose).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Reporting Pre-Specified Systemic Events
measure.description: Systemic events (fever ≥ 37.5 degrees Celsius [C], fever ≥ 38 C but ≤ 39 C, fever >39 C but ≤ 40 C, fever > 40 C, decreased appetite, irritability, increased sleep, decreased sleep, hives, use of medication to treat symptoms, and use of medication to prevent symptoms) were reported using an electronic diary. Participants may be represented in more than 1 category.
measure.population: The safety population included all subjects who received at least 1 dose of vaccine, (n) = number of participants reporting yes for at least 1 day or no for all days.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Antibody Concentration (GMC) in 13vPnC Group Relative After the 3-Dose Infant Series
outcome.description: GMC as measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) for 7 common pneumococcal serotypes (serotypes 4, 6B, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F) and 6 additional pneumococcal serotypes specific to 13vPnC (Serotypes 1, 3, 5, 6A, 7F, and 19A) are presented.
outcome.time_frame: one mone month after 3-dose infant series (at 7 months of age)
outcome.population: Evaluable immunogenicity population had valid and determinate assay results, and had no other major protocol violations.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
